{"step_by_step_thinking": "Sickle cell anemia is caused by a change in the structure of hemoglobin, which is a protein found in red blood cells. This change is due to a mutation in the gene encoding the hemoglobin B subunit polypeptide chain. Specifically, it is a single nucleotide mutation, as mentioned in Document [30]. This type of mutation is known as a point mutation.", "answer_choice": "C. Point mutation"}
